newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Coelce still a Flemings buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Coelce still a Flemings buy.

text.p: Robert Fleming & Co Ltd said Wednesday it has reiterated its buy recommendation on Brazilian state owned electrical utility Coelce.
-- "Coelce is the cheapest and fastest growing large cap utility in the electricity sector," analyst Walter Stoeppelwerth said in a report.

-- He cited Coelce's first-quarter sales growth of 14.9 percent, operating profit growth of 295.3 percent and growth earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) of 117.4 percent.
-- Moreover the company's bottom line climbed from a 585,000-real loss in first-quarter 1996 to first-quarter 1997 earnings of 7.6 million reais, he said.
-- "Coelce's first-quarter 1997 numbers were among the best we have seen in the electricity sector," he said.
-- "We continue to view Coelce as one of the most attractive plays on the above-average volume growth and privatization among Brazil's pure play distributors," he added.
-- Coelce is owned by northeastern Ceara state.
-- Coelce's preferred A share was off 0.21 percent at 4.70 reais while its common was up 2.04 percent at 5.00 reais at 1333 local/1633 gmt in Sao Paulo.
